program.name: python -m ep_bolfi.kadi_tools.read_csv_datasets
program.description: Please refer to the --help output of this file.

param.description: File name. If you want to give more than one, separate them by '?'. In that case, the file contents get concatenated.
param.name: filenames

param.description: Dictionary (enclose in quotation marks). Its keys are the indices of the columns which are to be read in . The corresponding values are there to tell this function which kind of data is in which column. The following format has to be used: '<name> [<unit>]'. For cycling data, 'name' is 'U' (voltage), 'I' (current), or 't' (time), and 'unit' is 'V', 'A', 'h', 'm', or 's' with the optional prefixes 'M', 'k', 'm', 'µ', or 'n'. This converts the data to prefix-less SI units. For impedance data, 'name' is 'f' (frequency), 'real_Z' (real part of impedance), 'imag_Z' (imaginary part of impedance), or 'ϕ' (phase), and 'unit' is 'Hz', 'Ω', 'rad', or 'deg'. The same prefixes as before can be used to convert the data to prefix-less SI units. Additional columns may be read in, if their 'name' is different.
param.name: headers

param.description: Optional max number of digits for the automatic reindexing of data from multiple files. Default is all digits found in the filenames. Setting this to 0 deactivates the number extraction from filenames.
param.name: automatic-numbering-digits

param.description: Number of comment lines to trim at the start of the file.
param.name: comment-lines

param.description: Column delimiter used in the file.
param.name: delimiter

param.description: Decimal symbol used in the file.
param.name: decimal

param.description: Type of the measurement, which determines the internal format for further processing. 'cycling' refers to Cycling_Information, 'static' to Static_Information' and 'impedance' to Impedance_Information. If you are unsure which to pick, consult the package documentation.
param.name: datatype

param.description: The index of the column that stores the index of the current segment.
param.name: segment-column

param.description: A list of indices which give the segments that shall be processed. Default is None, i.e., the whole file gets processed.
param.name: segments-to-process

param.description: Dictionary (give as Python-formatted string). Its keys are the strings used in the file to indicate a state. The column from which this state is retrieved is given by #correction-column. The dictionaries' values are used to correct/normalize the current value in the file.
param.name: current-sign-correction

param.description: Defaults to False, where measured voltage remains unaltered. Change to True if the voltage shall be multiplied by -1. Also applies to impedances; real and imaginary parts.
param.name: flip-voltage-sign

param.description: Defaults to False, where measured impedance remains unaltered. Change to True if the imaginary part of the impedance shall be multiplied by -1. Cancels out with 'flip-voltage-sign'.
param.name: flip-imaginary-impedance-sign

param.description: The maximum number of dataset lines that are to be read in.
param.name: max-number-of-lines
